item.description:
Haven: Titan Command is a 2-4 player sci-fi strategy card game set in an new and exciting galaxy where each player takes command of a hulking futuristic battle Titan. There are four rivalling factions currently at war, and each player must choose their allegiance, construct a deck and then charge into battle to claim victory for their faction.

The Core Set features over 190 cards, allowing players to build their own decks using a combination of faction and neutral cards to fully customise their Titan build. Each Titan build must carefully balance its reliance on combat equipment armed and activated during the fight, pilot manoeuvres which are activated as surprise actions to evade or ambush, and field skills which provide support from other battlefield units.

Players battle it out over a number of rounds until only one Titan is left standing victorious.

Simple Formula 1 race game.

It's the only one game published by "El taller del ocio", a little spanish publisher.

The player attempts to complete the circuit, overcoming obstacles in race, trying to make your team add more points than opponents or come first.

It is a game of rolling dice and move forward with some obstacles and a penalty die.

Druglord is a thematic war-game based on the history of Cartel's wars, with a strong commitment pro-legalization.

4-6 Players will impersonate and control the most powerful and dangerous Cartels in the world: Mafia, Yakuza, Triads, the Cartel of Medellín, the National Crime Syndicate and the Bratva (Russian Mafia). They'll have to distribute their forces all over the world, conquer the production places of drugs (for example: Colombia or Afghanistan) and the markets (cities like Los Angeles, Amsterdam or Tokio), organizing the flow of 4 kinds of substances that have different perks. This way players will gain soldiers that can be used to attack or defend; cooperation is acceptable, regulated and sometimes very useful. There are also cards to be drawn at each turn, inspired by historical or fictitious events related to the criminal world. They can have good or bad effects, and often there are choices to be made.

The goal is known at the beginning of the game, when each player draws a goal card (all different but balanced) that has to remain secret until the conditions of victory are fulfilled. There's also a semi-randomized countdown towards legalization: an event that in our point of view (and according to the ideas of many economists) would terminate the business of Cartels. When this happens (after 2-3 hours, according to the players' choices) the game is over and victory is assigned by points.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other (fancy) elements of Juicy Couture, a brand name.

name.value: Hit It! Tactical Card Game of Tennis

item.description:
Hit It! is a quick print & play card game of tennis for two players.

Each player has a deck of 25 cards, of three types to represent different tennis shots, plus two types of cards that modify shots. Each player sets out four cards face down to form the playing surface. (Choosing these cards adds an element of deck building to the game.) Each player takes six of the remaining cards from their deck. The first player "serves" by placing a card on one of the opponent's hitting zones and draws a replacement card from his deck. The opponent then moves his player marker to the ball and selects what card he will use to hit the ball back. This continues until one player manages to place a fourth card in a particular hitting zone, or a player is unable to return the ball.

Play continues until one player has won the set, i.e. six games.

Hit It! has abstracted tennis into a quick tactical card game, but retains the feel of the sport.

The long, lost island of Jungle Heart has just been discovered. What mysteries lie beneath its shadowy canopies?

Monstrous animals!

Vicious tribes!

Malicious militants!

Deadly traps and hazards!

Ghosts and demons!

Yet beyond all of these obstacles lies crumbling temples brimming with gold, jewels, and priceless relics.

In Jungle Heart, you and your opponents take on the role of an investor in the 1940s, sending adventurers, scientists, big game hunters and other pulp standards to the jagged rock shores of Jungle Heart to find the clues necessary to tap into the unlimited wealth of the island.

Game play is simple:

1) Recruit and equip your adventuring party... then it's "off we go" to the island.

2) Use supply tokens to pay for actions while on the island.

3) When the supplies run dry, your adventurers return to the mainland to regroup and reequip.

4) Play a victory card to earn points.

Jungle Heart is the second game in development from Wine Key Games and is capable of bringing hours--nay! weeks of indepth play.

Are you prepared to visit Jungle Heart?

A two player game played on an 18x24 board. Players each place two 2x6"mountains" on the board and then each place 54 soldiers(25mm plastic figures) on the 3 rows nearest them. Each player secretly selects a restricted set of 5 squares on his opponents rear row. 
 The winner is the first player to get his own soldiers on all five of these squares.
 On his turn a plyer takes a card and follows its instructions. He then rolls two dice, one die number represents the number of units he will move and the other die represnts the number of squares units move. He then moves his units and executes capture by replacement, some decided by die roll.
 As far as I can tell all the "Action" A-Toys are the same game on the same board but with different figures.

name.value: England Football Stars Limited Edition Monopoly

item.description: The World Cup is around the corner and stakes are high for England. Take on this limited edition and place your bids for the best players and venues from all over Britain. From our biggest stars, such as Joe Hart or Frank Lampard, to heroes from England's illustrious past, like Gary Lineker or David Beckham.

Players begin the game with 5 cards and they choose which number on each card they will use to bluff and win the round. During a round, each player must either make a bid of how many of a certain die they believe are shared amongst all players chosen dice -OR- call the previous player's bluff and say, "LIE!" The loser of the round may only draw back up to 4 cards next round and play continues until just one player remains!

There are several unique aspects to this 30-card mini micro game:

1. Players choose which dice they will bid and bluff with each round.
2. Each player holds extra hidden information based on which dice they DIDN'T use for the round.
3. The first player to bid in a round must choose which direction the bidding will proceed in.
4. 2 to 6 Players can play!
5. Several variants included.

Number 6 in the Pack O Game series.

item.description:
From inside the game: "At last the grand old Army game of shooting dice (craps) has been lifted into respectability- to be enjoyed often when friends meet."

Checker Dice consists of 126 cards (the game calls them "checkers") numbered from 2 to 12. The cards have pictures of die rolls, but the frequency of the numbers does not quite match the statistical likelihood of rolling those numbers on 2D6. For example, there are equal numbers of sixes, sevens, and eights.

To play, players turn over cards and hope to get certain numbers and avoid others, just as in Craps. Once a card is turned over, it remains face up for the remainder the player's turn, which slightly affects the statistical probability of finding another card with the same number.

A Trivial game about soccer and soccer-players. During your turn you have to draw 3 soccer-player counters from a draw pile of 72 and order them according to a random trait that could be: age, height, caps in the national team, caps in mundial, goal in the national team and goal in mundial.

Other players have to agree or disagrre to your decision.

All the players have also bet counter to use during the game.

name.value: Knights of Arthur: A Game of Knightly Adventure in the Age of King Arthur.

item.description:
BACKGROUND: Kinghts of Arthur is an adventure game where the players assume the role of a Heroic Knights in the age of King Arthur. The Player Knights are young, eager Knights anxious to prove themselves in order to become a Knight of the Round Table. In order to accomplish this, the Player Knights must seek out adventures and quests to improve their attributes and receive a grant from King Arthur to join the Knights of the Round Table.

Game-Play
Each Player creates their own Player Knight Character composed of the following Attributes: Virtue, Resolve, Chivalry, Stamina, Combat and Defense. Each Player Knight takes their turn individually, using a Player-Knight Counter to represent themselves on the Map. Each Player's Turn consists of the following actions:
SEQUENCE OF PLAY
1. Move, Heal wounds or Stay Put. Party may move, Heal or remain in the current location. 
2. Encounter Check: Roll on the Encounter Table for each area entered to determine if an Encounter occurs.
3. Resolve Encounter. If an Encounter occurs, roll on the Reaction Chart to determine the Encounter’s reaction. Resolve the Encounter to conclusion, including combat.
4. Conduct Knightly Action: The Player Knight may conduct one of the following Actions: Enter Town/Castle, Shop, Seek Entry to a Castle,Resolve Quest, Acquire a Ship, and several other actions.
5. Attribute Improvement: Player Knights may Trade in earned Valor Points to Improve their Attributes.

Combat is resovled on a Battle Mat representing a Castle and surroundings. The combat system is man-to-man and has the feel of skirmish fighting, but, resolved quickly without slowing the game.

Knights of Arthur is full of Arthurian Themes from various sources, but, especially from Sir Thomas Mallory's Le Morte D'Arthur. As a Knight, you will perform many Knightly duties including completing quests, dispatching bandits and brigands, participate in battles and sieges, rescuing damsels and possibly serving them. There are Tournaments to participate in and Monsters to slay!

If you enjoy books like Le Morte D'Arthur or movies like Excalibur, you will enjoy this game.

Knights of Arthur can be found at http://www.berserkergames.net

link.value: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

simple 'Roll&Move' game; ending on a red marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

English:
The King wants to know which of his battalions is the strongest and faithful. They will be tested and the best one, will become the royal guard and will get the king's favor.

Each battalion is composed by 5 soldiers, 3 swordsman, 1 squire and 1 knight.
Each soldier has a different force value and movement, so players would need to combine them adequately in order to conquest the king's districts and capture the enemy battalions.

On each turn, player has up 3 movements to be distributed on 
his soldiers. It should move at least one soldier per turn.

The king will announce 3 districts to conquest and then, the battalions will enter into the citadel to conquest it. The first one to have presence in the 3 districts will be the winner. Capturing soldiers enemies can also give the victory, as once 3 solders from a battalion are capture, they loses the conquest.

Once the winner of a conquest is declared. He take the district card and there is a new announcement. Then, a new district card is placed on the board to start a new conquest round.

The battalion that gets first 3 conquests (3 district cards), will become the king’s royal guard.

Spanish:
El Rey quiere saber cual de sus batallones es el mas fuerte y leal. Estos serán sometidos a prueba para determinar quien es el mejor, quien se convertirá en la guardia real y tendrán el favor del rey.

Cada batallón esta compuesta por 5 soldados: 3 espadachines, 1 escudero y 1 caballero.
Cada soldado tiene un valor de fuerza y movimiento diferente, por lo que los jugadores tendrán que combinarlos adecuadamente a fin de conquistar los distritos y capturar los batallones enemigos.

En cada turno, los jugadores tendrán hasta 3 movimientos para distribuir entre sus soldados. Deberá mover al menos 1 soldado una vez.

El rey anunciará 3 distritos para conquistar y es cuando los batallones entraran en la ciudadela para conquistarlo. El primero en tener presencia en los 3 distritos será el ganador. Capturar soldados enemigos también podría dar la victoria, pues una vez 3 soldados de un batallón son capturados pierden la conquista.

Una vez el ganador de la conquista es declarado, el jugador guarda la carta de distrito y nuevo anuncio del rey tendrá lugar. Entonces se saca una nueva carta de distrito y comienza una nueva ronda de conquista.

El batallón que consiga primero los 3 conquistas (3 cartas de distritos) será nombrado nueva guardia real.

item.description:
Vienga is a deck of cards that captures and simplifies the English language. Each depicts a letter, a number, and a clearly illustrated part of speech (noun, tense, adverb...) or sentence form. The back of the card has example sentences to show how each grammar point is used.

The Vienga cards can be used to play a variety of games. Simply use the cards to create equations, or words, or sentences. Vienga can be a challenging group game or a solo learning aid. The Vienga cards help you visualize sentence structures, recombine and replace words, and develop creative thinking. Challenging for native speakers and students with a good command of English wishing to improve their language skills.

Made entirely of wood and designed to be self-contained, Tabula is its own box. The game closes in on itself to become an sleek tabula, "tablet" in Latin. The name Tabula also comes from "Tabula Rasa", meaning "blank slate" - the board starts as a blank slate that then becomes filled with the tiles.

Tabula is a a simple turn-based strategy game in which the objective is to occupy the most spaces of the board. In this game, each player has access to four different type of special tiles that have unique abilities: Attack, Defense, Expansion, Jump. The game-play consists of playing either 1 special tile or two regular tiles (that have no abilities). The game ends when all the spaces of the board have been filled. Whoever has the most tiles is the winner.

Not only is this game a source of tremendous fun, but also is a beautiful aesthetic addition to the home.

The rules of "Red" are simple: highest card wins! But "Red" is just one of seven games you'll be playing in Red7, and if you're not winning the current game at the end of your turn, you're out! The last person standing wins the round.

The deck in Red7 is 49 cards: each of the colors of the rainbow numbered 1 to 7. A hand takes just a couple minutes!

item.description:
The King is looking for adventurers to fill his ranks of champions, an elite fighting force charged with protecting the King and doing his more “hands on” work.
In an attempt to weed out the weak from the application pool, the King conscripted the Royal Academy of Magi to construct a magical labyrinth. Loaded with deadly traps, vicious monsters and other contestants, you must live long enough to escape in order to become one of the chosen few. One of the Kings Champions!

Labyrintheus is a brand new dungeon survival card game that introduces a unique Persona Card System where you compete against you fellow party members to defeat Monsters and Avoid Traps while collecting Gate Stones. Gate Stones are used to activate the portal to the outside world.

One of the things that makes Labyrintheus unique is the persona card system. When you chose a character to play, you will have their persona card. More of a tile than a card, you use this for your inventory system and to track your health. Treasure cards collected in Labyrintheus are equipped by placing them along the appropriate edges of the persona card. And once you die, flip the persona card over to reveal your stats and abilities as an undead servant of the King. If you can't win, why should anyone else?!?

SUNDAY! SUNDAY! SUNDAY! Monster Truck Mayhem is invading the SuperMegaDome! Brought to you by Ridback Pub, 101 The Animal, and Big Al’s Sound Emporium! This thrill show spectacular will BLOW YOUR MIND! All your favorite trucks and more will be there… AND SO SHOULD YOU! Car crushing, Mud Sliding, Bus Jumping, and general mayhem for only $10! TEN BUCKS gets you the whole seat... but you will only need the edge Edge EDGE!

Race around the SuperMegaDome and be the first to cross the finish line!

Monster Truck Mayhem is a real-time dice rolling racing game. Players simultaneously roll their dice to race around the SuperMegaDome track and the winner is the first player to cross the finish line!

Players use custom dice to move 1, 2, or 3 spaces at a time. “Tire” and “Boost” are used to navigate course obstacles like the Car Crush, Bus Jump, Mud Pit, and more! Three “Boost” is an instant movement bonus. Three “Tires” causes another player to spin out!

Crush obstacles AND the competition and be the first Monster Truck to cross the finish line and take the checkered flag!

item.description:
In Who Stole the Cookie? you need to figure out who has both of your cookies because just one is never enough!

To set up, shuffle 2-3 cookie cards with 6-15 crumb cards depending on the number of players, then place two cards in the center of the table and deal two cards to each player, with everyone being able to peek at only one of their cards. On a turn, a player can:


 Peek: Look at any one face-down card.
 Switch: Switch the position of any two cards.
 Shuffle: Have someone shuffle the two cards in front of you, then look at one of them.
 Declare: Declare you know where two cookies are, choosing a card that you have or a card in the center of the table only if you can choose both of them. Secretly look at those cards, winning if you're correct and getting removed from the game if you're not. Find the cookies and you win!

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other (fancy) elements of the Great Canadian Gaming Cooperation.

From the rules:
Investo is a game of High Finance for three or more players. Play consists of investing In various companies, and receiving from the "INVESTO" Bank, Dividends and Bonuses in accordance with Instructions on a number of cards drawn by the players in rotation. Companies become bankrupt by the drawing of one of the Bankrupt cards.

TO BEGIN. One of the players is selected as Banker, and issues each of the players with £1,000 with which to make his or her investments; retaining the balance of the money as the "INVESTO" Bank. (The Banker is entitled to join in the game, and should also receive the initial £1,000.) The cards are then shuffled and placed face downwards in the centre of the table. The cards representing the ten companies are shuffled separately and placed face downwards beside the Banker, who is at all times in charge of the game. A number of company cards are then turned face upwards, in front of the Banker; the number so faced being one less than the number of players. (e.g. If five people are playing, then four company cards are turned up.) Players now invest in one or more of the companies as desired. All investments must be in multiples of £100. The Banker keeps a record of all investments.
 THE PLAY. The first player (determined by any method desired) then draws the top card and places it face up in front of him. Each card has a number of the top representing one of the companies. If the player drawing the card has invested in that company, he announces the dividend (e.g. No. 4 —30% or 6/- in the £). The Banker thereupon pays ALL players who have invested in No. 4 company, 30% of their investment, from the money in the Bank. Should the player not have invested in the company whose card is drawn, the play passes to the person next on his left, and so on round the table; each player announcing the dividend or bonus to be paid. ONLY If he has money invested in the company.

BANKRUPTCY. On a player drawing a "BANKRUPT" card for the company in which he has invested, he announces "No. 7 —Bankrupt", and then reads the directions as to payment to or from the Bank (e.g. "Shareholders must pay in 10/- for every £ invested, to meet the liabilities of the Company.") or "Shareholders receive 5/- for every £ invested in the Company, from the sale of assets," as the case may be. The Banker then collects the money from, or pays the money to, the shareholders in accordance with the instructions. After all the players have paid or received their money, the Banker removes the bankrupt company from play and exposes the next company card. Any player who had invested in the company that was just bankrupt now has the opportunity to invest in the new company. There is no compulsion, and a player who has money invested in another company may elect not to invest in the new company. On oil investments being completed and recorded by the Banker, play continues with the next player.

CHANGE OF INVESTMENT. Changes in investments can only be made when all the cards have been drown. All changes must be recorded by the banker who makes a charge of 10% on the total investment for the issue of the new "Script". (e.g. a player increases his investment as one of the companies from £200 to £500. The Banker charges £50.). 
GENERAL. After all the cards have been drawn, they are re-shuffled, placed face down, and commeacing with the player on the left of the person who drew the last card, play re-commences. When a company is bankrupt and there are no more companies to be exposed, the players who had invested in the last company to go bankrupt may choose any ONE of the remaining companies in which to invest. The game is cancluded when the last company is bankrupt. The winner is the player who finishes the game with the most money.

Slingshot, draft and setback your opponents, upgrade your car, stay out of the marbles and try not to crash!

INDYCAR Unplugged is a racing board game for 2-6 players ages 6 & up that plays in 10-30 minutes.

During your turn, play cards to advance your car. Opponents may play Setback cards to reduce your movement. At the end of your turn, fill your hand back to 5 cards. Be the first driver to complete the final lap to win the game!

Featuring Indy drivers JR Hildebrand, Scott Dixon, Tony Kanaan, Dario Franchitti, Josef Newgarden, and Simon Pagenaud.

The Let's Go To College game employs a gambling technique, with chips, to allow players to complete courses as a freshman, a sophomore, a junior, and a senior. Prentice employed illustrators to produce bright graphics in his games and utilized high quality materials as well.

From the rules:

SETTING UP THE GAME. The playing board with the colored chart is placed in the center of the table. The playing cards are lined up with the four packs of picture cards, face up, on one side of the playing board. They should be in this order: Freshman, Sophomore, Junior and Senior. On the other side of the board the four packs of Fun, Sports, Re-Exam and Flunk cards should be placed with these words up. The chips are divided among the players so that each has an equal amount of l's, 2's, 3's, 5's and 10's.

PLAYING THE GAME. The player on the left of the host plays first As a Freshman entering I. O. U., he stands up each time he plays. If he fails to remember this, he must draw a Flunk card as a penalty, altnougn he does not miss his turn. He pays 5 chips, registration fee, to the business office. He then rolls the dice on the playing board as he tries to pass his first course. Only the dice which remain on the board alter rolling , may be counted, using only the top numbers. He multiplies the dice total by ten to find his grade for the course. After rolling the dice, the player proceeds all follows: If, after multiplying, his grade comes to 120: he must pay 2 chips to petty expense, on the playing board, placing the chips so they do not interfere with the chart. If his grade is 110, he must pay 1 chip. This means he has tried too hard to pass. In either case he rolls the dice again, right away. If his grade is 100, 90, 80 or 70, he can draw the top Freshman Course card and keep it. He also must take or put chips into petty expense as indicated opposite his grade on the chart. If there are not enough chips to take, he is out of luck, and can take only what is there. This happens quite frequently throughout the game. If his grade is 60, 50 or 40, he must place on playing board the indicated number of "put" chips. He then has his choice of drawing a Fun, Sport or Re-Exam card. He must read his card aloud and after fulfilling the duties, he returns it to the bottom of the same pack. 
If his grade is 30, 20 or 10, he must place on playing board the indicated number of "put" chips. He then has to take a Flunk card and follow its instructions before returning it to bottom of pack. If both dice roll off the playing board he receives a zero, and must place 15 chips on the board and draw a Flunk card. As soon as a player has completed his turn, the next player on his left rolls the dice to obtain his grade for his first Freshman course, and so on. To pass Freshman year and become a Sophomore, a player must hold two Freshman Course cards. The first to finish Freshman year receives all chips in Petty Expense. As soon as each player finishes his first year he must pay 5 chips, registration fee for Sophomore year, to the business office. Sophomore year is the same as Freshman year, only players may now be seated while playing. Sophomores must have two Soph Course cards before becoming Juniors. The first to finish receives all chips in petty expense. As soon as players finish Sophomore year they pay 5 chips, registration fee for Junior year, to the business office. Junior year proceeds the same as Sophomore year. The first to finish receives all chips in petty expense. As soon as a player gets two Junior Course cards he must pay 5 chips, registration fee for Senior year, to the business office. Seniors must obtain the usual two Senior Course cards before graduation. The first to finish Senior year receives all chips petty expense and IMMEDIATELY the game is ended.

From Sailor Boy to Admiral, A New Naval Game of Great Interest, was produced by C.W. Faulkner & Co. around 1900 and printed in Bavaria. The game was one of their "Upidee" series which featured cards laid out to form a track for a race game. The set includes 20 cards with numbered and beautifully illustrated slots, five standing figures of "Sailor boys", bifold instructions, spinning die called a teetotum and box.

The game is played by first laying out the cards in order to form a track. Each player chooses a sailor boy, paying five counters into the pool. Players spin the teetotum and place their sailor on that number, and continue to move him along the board based on the teetotum numbers thrown. When a player lands on a picture, they must follow certain rules, such as: 1 – Enter the Royal Navy and join the training ship. Receives one counter from each player. 50 – is tried by courtmartial on a charge of drunkenness on duty, and sentenced to lose five years seniority. Pays three counters into the pool and goes back to 39.

The box measures 3 13/16" x 4 3/4" 1 1/4". The cards (track) measure 3 5/8" x 2 1/8". The sailor boys stand 2 1/2". Teetotum measures 2" x 1".

"The break-through will be of decisive importance. We must and will therefore conquer, settle for ever with the centuries-long struggle, end the war, and strike the decisive blow against our most detested enemy. We will finish with the British, Indians, Canadians, Moroccans, and other trash, feeble adversaries, who surrender in great numbers if they are attacked with vigour." (Order of the Day, issued on the 29th October and found on a dead officer of the XV. Corps).

The Battle of the Marne signaled the failure of the Schlieffen Plan and of German hopes to win a quick, decisive victory. In turn, this triggered the Race for the Sea as opposing armies attempted to outflank each other. Then, in a final bid to gain the upper hand, both Allied and German Armies clashed in the First Battle of Ypres. On these fields, the British Expeditionary Force, the professional army of Britain, and the strongest on the Continent, was bled dry.

Ypres 1914 is a brigade/regiment level simulation of the First Battle of Ypres. Players assume the roles of the commanders of the German and Allied troops as they desperately fight for this valuable position in the line.

The 17 x 22" map (with 3/4" hexes) covers Flanders battlefield. The 480 1/2" counters (die-cut and back-printed) show German, British, French and Belgian forces involved in the battle.

name.value: De Kolonisten van Catan: Het Oude Egypte
Die Siedler von Catan: Das Alte Ägypten

item.description:
For Catan: Ancient Egypt, designer Klaus Teuber has transformed his best-selling game The Settlers of Catan to a new location and time, with players now living in the time of the Pharaohs and using their oxcarts to move resources to build small villages and great temples styled after some of the most interesting buildings of Egyptian antiquity. As always, you must beware of the robber! His chariot can interrupt production at your cattle pastures, papyrus groves and quarries.

After you master the Catan: Ancient Egypt base game, you can try these variants:


 Help from the Gods: Ten god cards are now available to player, with their powers adding a variety of options for dynamic gameplay.
 The Great Pyramid: Players can now build and move papyrus boats across the Nile to compete for the pharaoh's blessing and the vizier's favor by building blocks onto the great pyramid.

item.description:
Lisboa is a game about the reconstruction of Lisboa after the great earthquake of 1755.

On November 1, 1755, Lisbon suffered an earthquake of an estimated magnitude of 8.5–9.0, followed by a tsunami and three days of fires. The city was almost totally destroyed. The Marques of Pombal — Sebastião José de Carvalho e Melo — was the then Minister of Foreign Affairs and the King put him in charge of the reconstruction of Lisbon. The Marques of Pombal gathered a team of engineers and architects and you, the players, are members of the nobility; members who will use your influence in the reconstruction and business development of the new city. You will work with the architects to build Lisbon anew, with the Marquis to develop commerce and with the King to open all the buildings, but the true reason you do all this is not for greatness or fame or even fortune, but for the most important thing of all in that time: wigs.

Lisboa is played on a real map of downtown Lisbon. During the planning of the downtown project, the type of business permitted in each street was previously determined. The economic motor is driven by the wealth of the royal treasure and this treasure is controlled by player actions during the game, making each game a totally different experience. The game ends after a fixed number of rounds and whoever gathers the most wigs by the end of the game wins.

Lisboa is played in rounds. Each round, all players play one turn. They may place one card on their display or replace one card from this display. During the game, players schedule hearings to get character favors, such as commerce, construction, and openings. The iconic buildings score the stores and stores provide income to the players. Players need to manage influence, construction licenses, store permits, church power, workers and money, with the workers' cost being dependent on the prestige of the players.

item.description:
Do you know your way around restaurants and kitchens as well as Steffen Henssler? Right out of the starting blocks, you'll need to hunt for the right ingredients? What should you drink when you order a Pharisee? What color is a Weißherbst? What does "thickening" mean? Answer these and other questions correctly, and you'll win the ingredients that you need for his recipe.

The quick quiz game Hensslers Küchenrallye, which can be played individually or in teams, was developed in close co-operation with Steffen Henssler, and the cooking fan will discover special tips from the celebrity chef as well as original recipes.

With Guinness World Records: Das Spiel, everyone can experience this fantastic history of world records at the gaming table, with approximately 400 illustrated question cards that players large and small can all guess at — and the closer you are to the right answer, the more points you receive.

"The Word Game Preferred by Ladies and Gentlemen of Rare Distinction."

A dice and tile press-your-luck word game for 2-6 players. Using a combination of wooden tiles and artisan dice, players attempt to create words based on their dice roll. Each letter die multiplies the word score. Players must then decide whether to stop and score or draw another die, roll again, and risk it all!

Each letter and die has a point value similar to Scrabble. The twist is in the multiplication of your score by the number of letter dice used.

In each round, the player begins by rolling one die. The player uses that die and nine wooden tiles to make a single word. The player can stop there and score, or bank the used tiles to score later, take an additional die, roll both dice, and make a new word with the remaining tiles. This new word will now be scored with a multiplier of 2 (with 2 dice). Players can continue with this adding dice and making words as long as they have tiles left. If a player fails to make a word, they score only their banked tiles with no multipliers.

An unusual-looking game in which the playing field "flips" its rows depending on how the playing pieces are distributed. The wooden game features eight rocking levers in a board that contains 64 spaces. The winner is the first player who gets four pieces off the board.

Which happened first: the Salem Witch Trials or the foundation of Harvard College? Was Watergate before Woodstock? Sure, it's easy to know whether the discovery of America came before the Deepwater Horizon oil spill, but how well can you remember everything that happened in between?

In Timeline: American History, players have hands of cards and take turns attempting to place the cards correctly into the growing timeline. Easy at first, but rapidly growing more difficult, Timeline: American History tests your knowledge and helps you learn the history of the nation.

Beware of the cleansing water holes as you roll, and stick to the beautifully pure mud baths...

The Big Apple is a boardgame of city building for 1-4 players. It lasts about 30-45 minutes. In this game, each player is the mayor of a city and must build the most efficient
city.

In each turn, players must choose a city tile from several available and place it immediately in their own city according to the tile placement rules. There are 96 city tiles:
-32 residence tiles
-24 employment tiles
-30 public building tiles or services
-10 monuments

The aim of the game is to have the optimal number of services and to place them near the residences to get victory points and win the game. Job creation is also very important. Each player should have an employment tile for each residence tile he or she has. Finally, monuments help players to win some extra points.

"La Gran Manzana" es un juego de mesa de construcción de ciudades para 1-4 jugadores. Tiene una duración aproximada entre 30 y 45 minutos. En este juego, cada jugador desempeña el papel de alcalde de una ciudad y debe construir la ciudad más eficiente.

En cada turno, los jugadores eligen una pieza de entre varias disponibles y debe colocarla a continuación en su propia ciudad de acuerdo a las reglas de colocación de piezas. Hay 96 piezas de ciudad:
-32 piezas de residencia.
-24 piezas de empleo.
-30 piezas de edificio público o servicios.
- 10 piezas de monumento.

El objetivo del juego es tener la cantidad óptima de servicios y colocarlos cerca de las residencias para conseguir puntos de victoria y ganar el juego. La creación de empleo es también muy importante. Cada jugador debería tener una pieza de empleo por cada pieza de residencia. Finalmente, los monumentos ayudarán a los jugadores a ganar algunos puntos extra.

item.description:
In Museums: The Card Game you are a Museum Director trying to build the best museums with the most amount of items and the best visitors you can attract.

Each player will have a hand of cards. On your turn you have four options. You can (1) play a Museum cards, (2) play an Artifact card on Museums, (3) play a Visitor card, or (4) draw a card from the draw deck. You are limited to playing three actions per turn. The first two actions can be playing Museums and/or Artifact cards and the third action can be playing one Visitor card. If you choose not to play a card, you may draw a card instead. Likewise, if you choose not to play any cards you may draw three cards.

Museum cards are played first and then Artifact cards are played on top of Museum cards. The Artifact has to match the type of Museum it is played on. Visitor cards are played to score points. Once a Visitor card is played, for each artifact card with the same interests as the Visitor, all players score one point.

The goal of the game is to reach 20 points. The first to reach the goal is the winner.

Driven from Rokugan by the wrathful forces of the Emerald Champion, the Dark Naga and his enslaved minions have wound their way through the treacherous lands between the Empire and the Colonies and emerged, secretive, near the outskirts of the Second City. The humans will pay for their effrontery. This insult will not go unanswered.

There will yet be an empire of serpents that will bring to an end the tyranny of the mammals, and the Second City will be but the first to burn.

Siege: Heart of Darkness is a new way to play multiplayer Legend of the Five Rings, pitting multiple players as defenders of the city against one assailant piloting the Siege deck. Face the dread Dark Naga forces with either the three decks included in this product (or with your own) and take part in the defense of the Second City for the glory of the Empire of Rokugan.

Game description from the publisher:

The jobs available in Odd Jobs are hilarious, screwy and over-the-top, and the workers are even crazier. One player is the "client", choosing a card and reading aloud the job. All other players use their business cards, selecting the best one for the job, and telling the client why they should be hired! Sometimes the amusing names and witty taglines sell themselves, sometimes you may want to act the part and boast about your imaginary skills!

Missionsspiel (Eng. Game of Missions) was published in 1930's in Germany by Salvator-Verlag. The game is about Pope Pius XI and his Catholicism missions through continents. The players are missionaries. They start in Rome and travel around the world, until they reach Rome again.

There are two different sets of rules for the game. One concentrates more on the travel adventures, whereas the other concentrates primary on the collection of money for the mission.

- Typical roll and move board game where the first player who cross 120 stops (travels around the world), wins the game.

- The player who collects the most money wins the game.

Game board: 44 x 66 cm;
Box: 27,5 x 34 cm.

You are the crew of the HMS Defiant. One of you is planning a mutiny. The Mutineer's goal: to survive while the others attempt to discover you.

Players take on the role of one of the 8 crew members on the ship: Chaplain, Boatswain, Quartermaster, Surgeon, Navigator, First Mate, Master Gunner, or Cabin Boy. Roles are public knowledge, but the identity of the mutineer remains hidden. Over the course of two rounds, players try to discover the mutineer through discussion, accusation, denial, and special actions. The game ends with a vote to convict one player guilty of mutiny. If the mutineer is voted guilty, all the other players win. Otherwise, the mutineer wins.

Each role has unique abilities that may help reveal the mutineer or allow them to exert control over the the voting. Since any player could be the mutineer, an accusation could be helpful, or a clever attempt to re-direct suspicion elsewhere. Mutiny is a social game with a minimal rule set. The game instead relies on player discussion and interaction to drive the game.

[redacted] is a game of spycraft, intrigue, betrayal, and bluffing set in the golden age of the cold war, when men knew how to drink a Martini, and women knew not to trust a man who claimed to know how to drink a Martini.

In the game, spies must infiltrate the embassy during the reception that the ambassador holds every year to show how important he is. Moving from room to room, they have to recover files and escape in the helicopter, or make sure that the other side's pilots have a really bad day.

While interacting with each other, the players seek to interrogate, steal or injure when they can. With a double-blind interaction mechanism that never really lets the tension ebb, a skilled agent will need to do a lot more than see through a bluff...

item.description:
This game allows 2-4 players (2-6 with the Avant Garde expansion) to experience and survive the chaotic times of the French Revolution. This is the first of nine releases planned for a fun deck building that can all be connected to play as one game.

The Avant Europa series allows you to walk through important times in the history of France and other nations of Europe. Have your own shot at impacting history by making the choices that change it. Witness the events that shaped the national histories of that era, and try to survive them while building your own political Empire.

The Avant Europa - Liberte storyline represents the viewpoint of various small noble factions. Starting out with a small Commune you build up your connections and influences in Politics, Lands, Trade, Economics, Goods, and Military. The goal is to protect France from it's enemies (inside and out), but also to be the one player with the most Victory Points amassed at the end of the game. As your Empire of influence grows at some point you can end up commanding great influence and power across Revolutionary France.

Players begin with a standard deck of 8-10 cards - depending on if playing the basic, intermediate, or advanced rules. The game runs from 12 turns (basic) to 28 turns (full version), divided into turns called "Seasons". At the beginning of each Season players draw four cards into hand. Play continues in Rounds until all but the last player have used or played all of the cards in their hand. That player gets one last Round of play and the Season ends.

Each Season player initiative is important because being First Player to start a Season gives that player first go at available cards in the Commons to purchase. Like many deck-building games there is the typical 1-and-1 Round, where a player can play 1 Action and gets 1 additional choice (usually to Purchase cards from the Commons that get added to the owners discard - and thus eventually to the players hand).

In addition players can move cards to their Domain, which reflects their public face to the world. Cards in Domain are not discarded until used and can be played as if from hand. Many give special abilities and benefits that increase a players ability to response to other players actions, increase income generated by other cards, have special means of defense, etc. To add even more color to game play these Domains can come with Asset cards that are unique to the controlling player and provide political flavour of the times to expand the options of game play.

This game is a very diverse peek into the life and times of the people of the era's it represents. Actual historical personalities and figures of the Revolution are available as Allies, along with the actual historically political factions, organizations, and local government forces of the day.

Unique mechanics include the ability to Raise Funds that the player can add to their treasury to help purchase cards, make bribes, and pay off Tax collectors -- which were the common bane of public that lead to the Revolution. Other unique mechanics include the ability to place Bribes on cards in Commons area, the ability to Power Block some cards to prevent others from using or getting them. Players can engage in gathering Goods that can be sold on the open market for increased income. Players have the option of building up basic militia forces to protect themselves against common Bandits or foreign powers, or to use their military to defend against other players once the anger of the French Revolution and civil conflict goes into full swing.

Every card in the game has two or more uses, which is what makes provides the plethora of strategic choices and card combinations. The game promises no two play sessions of this game will be exactly the same, and it is easy to see why given the options. The game will certainly appeal to veteran card fans of games like L5R or Magic who appreciate the artistic details. It will also appeal to players who have played out their copies of Dominion and want something far more immensely real then Ascension or Thunderstone.

There are many roads to Victory, largely based on the acquisition of certain key cards of value -- especially getting control of Cities and Ports of France. This can be done many ways, through political underhanded activities, military force, or economic control. The person with the most Victory Points accumulated at games end determines the winner. However there are other ways to win the game outright, such as by getting three Historical Events into a players Domain.

The strategic depth of this unique deck-builder game surpasses anything you have played before. With over 16 core strategies that you can pursue in combination to arrive at final victory, you will find yourself playing multiple times to figure out your own preferred winning combo.

This release Avant Europa - Liberte covers the period of the early French Revolution (1789 - 1793). More expansions are planned to follow, including three covering the rise of Napoleon, and three that cover the early years of French settlement in North America. The truly historical fans will be able to play all the released expansions modules in sequence from start to finish if they wish. You will be able to relive French History from 1600 to 1815.

Available expansions for this game include Avant Europa - Nationale (Age of Sail)which includes the years of trade and exploration before the Revolution (1760-1788). There is also the Avant Garde expansion which is both a two player introduction to the AE Universe, but that also served as the 5 and 6 player expansion for the base "AE-Liberte" release.

Other releases for "Avant Britannia" and "Avant Hispania" are also planned.

Monopoly type game about the film industry.
Game play: player throws the dice and moves his pawn around the board the number of aquares indicated by the dice total. Landing on a studio, theater or story the player may buy it by paying the price indicated on the board etc..like in Monopoly.
The game ends whenever the Director's pack is exhausted; when all but one player is bankrupt; at any time by mutual agreement.

A wargame based off the anime "Girls & Panzer". In the anime, girls study tankery, and have tank battles akin to high school sports. The tanks fire ammunition that can damage the other tanks, but are non-lethal. Though it takes place in modern day, it uses World War II tanks.

Each player has a group of tanks and characters they control, which vary by scenario. The tanks have values for movement, attack modifier, size modifer, movement points, and front/side/rear armor. Characters give have special limited-use abilities and modifiers for the tanks they're with.

Each player starts with 5 cards, and draws 1 each turn. They use the cards to determine what actions they use each turn, such as movement (sometimes one tank, sometimes many), fire, a combination of both (with different modifiers), or other abilties. Other cards may be used as reactions to a card played by the other player, and some are special effects that happen upon drawing the card.

Game system is based on World Tank Battles.
A sequel Panzer Vor Ausf. 2 was published in 2016.

item.description: The EXTRACTOR Word Game is inspired by Scrabble, but features a twist to make play more strategic: You can extract letters from words that are on the board, as long as removal of the letter(s) doesn't invalidate any words in play. Then those letters are yours to use!

Stockpile is an economic board game that combines the traditional stockholding strategy of buy low, sell high with several additional mechanisms to create a fast-paced, engaging and interactive experience.

In Stockpile, players act as stock market investors at the end of the 20th century hoping to strike it rich, and the investor with the most money at the end of the game is the winner. Stockpile centers on the idea that nobody knows everything about the stock market, but everyone does know something. In the game, this philosophy manifests in two ways: insider information and the stockpile.

First, players are given insider information each round. This information dictates how a stock’s value will change at the end of the round. By privately learning if a stock is going to move up or down, each player has a chance to act ahead of the market by buying or selling at the right time.

Second, players purchase their stocks by bidding on piles of cards called stockpiles. These stockpiles will contain a mixture of face-up and face-down cards placed by other players in the game. In this way, nobody will know all of the cards in the stockpiles. Not all cards are good either. Trading fees can poison the piles by making players pay more than they bid. By putting stocks and other cards up for auction, Stockpile catalyzes player interaction, especially when potential profits from insider information are on the line.

Both of these mechanisms are combined with some stock market elements to make players consider multiple factors when selling a stock. Do you hold onto a stock in hopes of catching a lucrative stock split or do you sell now to avoid the potential company bankruptcy? Can you hold onto your stock until the end of the game to become the majority shareholder, or do you need the liquidity of cash now for future bidding? Do you risk it all by investing heavily into one company, or do you mitigate your risk by diversifying your portfolio?

In the end, everyone knows something about the stock market, so it all comes down to strategy execution. Will you be able to navigate the movements of the stock market with certainty? Or will your investments go under from poor predictions?

item.description:
Dungeon Lords: Happy Anniversary includes the Dungeon Lords base game, the Festival Season expansion, stickers for food tokens, metal coins, a new "Dungeon Set-up" mini-expansion, and other items.

In Dungeon Lords, you are an evil dungeon lord who is trying to build the best dungeon out there. You hire monsters, build rooms, buy traps and defeat the do-gooders who wish to bring you down. Each turn, players use a hand of cards to choose where to place their worker imps. Actions vary from mining gold, hiring monsters, buying traps etc. Each action has three spots available - with each spot having different effects (e.g., mining gold lets you mine more gold in each spot). When using the cards, two cards will become locked and will not be able to be used next turn.

The entire game lasts two "game years", and each year consists of four seasons (a.k.a. turns). At the start of each season, players see the heroes and events to come in the following season, allowing them to prepare. At the end of each season after the first, heroes are allocated to each player according to the players' level of evilness. Heroes range from mighty heroes to sneaky thieves. Each hero has its own power for which the player needs to prepare for. At the end of each year, the heroes travel into the dungeons to fight.

Scoring in the game is based upon what you have built, the monsters you have hired and the heroes you have captured.

The Festival Season expansion adds a fifth season to the year: festival season. More time to build your dungeon, but also more time for adventurers to gather a larger party. There are new monsters, rooms, and traps to prepare your dungeon for the battle, but also new nasty spells for the adventurers and sneaky bards who encourage them to perform so-called "heroic" deeds – not to mention two paladins for each year, now ready to punish up to two evil players.

Would you like to push other players toward evil instead of moving yourself toward good when visiting the city? What about making an investment instead of traditional gold digging? Or what about repairing conquered tunnels or rooms instead of digging new ones? Only eight actions are still available to you, but each season one of those actions is replaced by an alternate set of spaces that offer new and intriguing options. And did we mention that it has recently become fashionable for dungeon lords to have their own personal pets?

Each player is issued 4 celluloid markers each marked LONG on one side and SHORT on the other. They place them on the board on the 'PLACE ORDERS HERE' square for any of 12 different stocks. There are 10 squares above and below this square and rolling the 3 special bakelite dice will tell you which stocks change value and whether they go up or down. 2 of the dice contain the names of the 12 companies on the game board and a 3rd dice has 3 'UP' and 3' DOWN' values. name.value: Omertà, el poder de la mafia

item.description:
Omertà, el poder de la mafia is a highly strategic card game, in which each player leads one of the five mafia families from NYC. Set in the 30s-40s, the families have to fight for the control of their businesses (arms trade, prostitution, illegal gambling...), spread around NYC's five neighborhoods (Queens, Manhattan, Bronx, Staten Island and Brooklyn). Each family has a main goal to achieve during the game, and several secondary objectives that can make the family improve.

By means of money and respect points, each family can increase its members (gangsters, soldiers), who will help control the domains and businesses their family owns.

Strategic balance between defense of one's possessions and the conquest of new domains will be key to the game, but chance will also take part in it, as attacks, defense movements and several other actions required by many event cards will make us throw the dice.

The final goal of the game is to fulfill the requirements set in a main goal card given out at the beginning of the game, and achieving in addition as many secondary objectives as possible, which will bring us additional respect points.

Original Spanish description:
Omertà, el poder de la mafia, es un juego de cartas altamente estratégico, en el que cada jugador guía los designios de una de las cinco familias mafiosas de Nueva York. Ambientado en los años 30-40. Cada Familias deberá pugnar por el control de los negocios (tráfico de armas, prostitución, apuestas ilegales, ...) que se encuentran repartidos en los dominios de los cinco barrios de Nueva York (Queens, Manhattan, Bronx, Staten Island y Brooklyn). Cada Familia tendrá un objetivo principal a cumplir durante su partida, y varios secundarios que le darán la posibilidad de mejorar su familia.

Por medio del dinero y los Puntos de Respeto podremos ir haciendo crecer nuestra familia (capos, soldados), que a su vez controlarán los dominios y negocios que su familia tenga en su poder.

El equilibrio estratégico entre la defensa de nuestras posesiones y la conquista y asalto de nuevos dominios será la clave del juego, que no se ve libre de un cierto efecto "suerte", ya que los ataques, defensas y ciertas acciones requeridas por las variadísimas cartas de Evento nos llevarán a realizar tiradas de dados.

El objetivo final del juego es cumplir los requisitos establecidos por una carta de objetivo principal que se nos entregará al comienzo de la partida, pudiendo cumplir además tantos objetivos secundarios como seamos capaces y que nos aportarán Puntos de Respeto adicionales.”

Each player controls a small squad of soldiers operating during major ww2 battle. Each soldier belongs to a specific class with unique abilities like heavy gunner, rifle man, mechanic, driver, medic and gun operator. Each unit consists of 2-4 soldiers (each unit is built around a commanding officer). Every soldier can gain a level up, making him more efficient in battle, or giving more abilities.

During players turn player issues a basic order to his troops like "advance","fall back","move to left/right flank",attack a unit. While orders can be precised to specific units and target. Way they're handled is up to units and their officers in command. During action units that suffered a casualty might flee, decide to fortify, or even advance in counterattack. Goal of the game is to gain control over battlefield by either eliminating enemy units or gaining points of interest. However, the player is operating in a small section of battlefield and has to take into account that not only units visible on the map are a threat.

Original game design was for 2 players. But solo campaign and cooperative play are also in works. Also game is prepared to take into account game masters possibilities using special set of story and event cards.

item.description:
The playing pieces are moved by a handheld magnet under the game board. The goal is to complete a prior arranged slalom course in the shortes time with the fewest mistakes.

This game was published in the 1950s.

The Táin is a card driven wargame game for two players based on the Táin Bó Cúailnge or The Cattle Raid of Cooley. This is an epic story of early Irish Literature. It tells of a war against Ulster by the Connacht queen Medb and her husband Ailill, who intend to steal the bull Donn Cuailnge, opposed only by the Ulster hero Cuchulain.

Can Cuchulain hold off an entire army single-handedly or will Medb’s warriors win the day?

The Object of the Game
Cuchulain must slay three of Queen Meb’s chosen champions to win. If he dies before he does this Queen Medb wins.

Turn Order
Cuchulain begins with 6 Battle Cards in hand, Queen Medb with 5 Battle Cards. The game is played in alternating turns, beginning with Queen Medb. A turn consists of two phases: Support and Combat.

On a player’s turn they will first Support

1. Draw back to 5 or 6 Battle Cards in hand depending upon the player. Shuffle the discard deck if necessary to create a new Draw Deck. If a player has more than their starting number of cards in hand, they do not draw new ones. Players always draw cards to replenish their hand at the start of their turn.

2. The player may then choose to:

Play one Battle Card from hand as an Event, either discarding the card or removing (in this case the card will state it is to be removed)
or
Discard one or more Battle Cards from hand for action points, marking the Action Points (AP) on the respective track.
or
Play one Battle Card from hand as an Attack or Defense Stat Boost. The card is placed horizontally to the right of Cuchulain or Medb’s Champion, aligning with their base Attack and Defense values. In subsequent turns, additional cards may also boost these stats. Overlap each card so that the values can be read horizontally.
or
Play one Battle Card from hand to Heal, discarding the card. This option may only be chosen by Cuchulain

3. Then, if the player chooses to, they may Combat as the Attacker

4. When the Combat phase has ended, discard all cards played the Combat Lines to their respective discard decks.

item.description:
In 1936, the Universal Games Company of St. Louis, Mo. published the Mor-Fun Stock Exchange game. It was a bit out of the ordinary as the game board was made of 1/4" thick pressed board stock and had a long heavy metal spinner that spun on bearings. The lowest cost 'Home Model' sold for $5, which was a lot for a game in the 1930s. By comparison, the very popular game of Monopoly retailed for $2.00.

There was no scrip or play money with the game, the only trading was done with stock shares. The players trade stocks; the amount traded and the profit is determined by spinning the metal spinner then throwing the dice.

Each player is assigned a player number and in turn is a 'buyer' and spins the indicator bar. The player whose number the indicator lands on is the 'seller'. The number of stock shares will be shown under the players number where the indicator stops. The 'seller' then rolls the dice to determine the amount of profit the 'buyer' must pay for the stock shares. Multiply the number thrown on the dice by the number of shares to be transacted equals the amount of shares the 'buyer' must pay the 'seller'.

In addition, there are 'Futures', Margins', and the 'Pit' where players may be required to put shares of stock that can subsequently be won by any player as described in the rules.

The player who acquires the most stock at the end of the game wins. A player who runs out of stocks is eliminated from the game and play continues to an agreed upon time.

There is no scrip or game money, all transactions are completed with shares of stock.

Two games in one.
In the first game, the players are superheroes and try to reach the last square marked with a M, during the race the villains try to stop the superheroes. The player who arrives first wins.
In the second game, the doctor octopus try to reach the M square before spiderman capture him.

When I woke up, I was trapped in a book. I was inside the kingdom of fairy tales! I had to act quickly, in cooperation with the friends I met there, to plan my escape from that world. However, only one person could make it out safely...

To start the game, each player is dealt 1 fairy tale "heroine card" (Cinderella, Snow White, etc.) and 1 "attendant card." Using the abilities listed on these cards, as well as other cards drawn throughout the game, players attempt to collect heart pieces, create a heart key, and escape from Fairyland together with their attendant before other players manage to do so. Remember, only one person can ESCAPE from FAIRYLAND!!!

D24 Wrestling can be played with one to four players. It combines the elements of dice rolling (with a D24 die!) action, strategy, role play and simulation into one awesome package, with matches taking place in real-time!

D24 Wrestling features faces (good guys), heels (bad guys), combining for a total of 20 unique playing cards. Each card has a full color illustration on the front, and game play stats on the back. We have main event stars (like Superbandit, Goliath, all the way down to low carders like Tadpole). The unpredictability of the D24 die adds to the "anything can happen" feel of the game!

There are two versions of the game: basic and advanced. A "basic" match begins when two players roll the d24 to see which wrestler will start on offense. The player that gained control will then roll on his wrestler's offensive set (each wrestler has 24 moves, including their finisher(s)! For the offensive wrestler to stay in control, he must roll successfully vs. the skill rating (power, speed, technical, brawling, aerial and striking). The offensive wrestler loses control when he does not roll successfully vs. his skill rating; then the opponent takes over on offense (just like a real match!). When a wrestler hits their finisher, the opponent must roll their 3-Count or Submission Rating, plus the opponent's finisher rating, to see if he is defeated. If the opponent rolls their 3-Count Rating or below, the match is over and the opponent wins (there are also other random ways to win, such as pin scenarios on the "Into the Ropes Action Chart").

The advanced game turns up the heat with more strategy options and player input. The advanced game allows a wrestler to attempt pins up to three times during the course of a match. Strength of moves is taken into account (some moves are more damaging than others). Maximum Damage Points from close pins/submission attempts, and finishers indicate how hurt a wrestler is, including blood! The advanced game also allows for wrestlers to use steel chairs and other foreign objects...but be careful, a disqualification may result! Other options found in the advanced version: exiting the ring, suicida moves, finisher counters, submission wrestling--you have four turns to get out of a basic submission move, and three for a submission finisher--or you tap out!

The game comes complete with a storyline that also allows you to take on the role of owner/booker/promoter and run your own version of WOX! Crown champions, develop feuds, determine rankings, create TV and house shows that culminate in pay per views! Schedule tournament and play nights or focus on the storyline element of the game...you're in charge!

item.description:
ASAT is a board game of orbital combat in the foreseeable future. Pilot your spacecraft against other spacecraft in Earth’s orbit, using simple but accurate orbital physics rules.

ASAT is a PnP, low complexity war game game of space combat in Earth orbit. As your ship orbits the Earth, use celestial mechanics, and your ship's thrust, sensors, and weapons to close in, target, and attack your opponent - before they do the same to you!

Players control one or more ships orbiting the Earth in one of several discrete orbits. Turns are meant to simulate simultaneous action. On each turn, (a) the players (optionally) move using thrust, or let the ships continue in their present orbit, (b) attempt to locate and detect an enemy using sensors, (c) once a detection is successful, attack the opposing ship using weapons, and (d) defend against attacks and tally up inflicted damage.

The game continues until one player's ships are destroyed, or one player is able to retreat by de-orbiting and successfully re-entering the atmosphere to land on Earth.

Lords of Grevelheim is a competitive deckbuilding game in which players strive for control over the city of Grevelheim.
Each player starts the game with his own deck of cards representing his loyal followers. The game plays out in rounds with players taking turns playing cards to gain Gold, Attack Points, Defense Points or other special effects. Players then use a deckbuilding mechanic to improve their deck by recruiting new and stronger followers from a selection of different guilds.

The game is currently fully playable but still in developement.
If you would like to playtest the free PnP version or would like to contribute in any way to the game feel free to head over to the game's main thread in the design forum.

item.description:
Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet! is a fast-paced, "gateway" game where you use the moon and spacecrafts to get your Aliens off the planet before it explodes!

The game has a casual space theme and never takes itself too seriously. Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet! is easy to learn, fast-paced game, where everyone feels engaged and "in it" until someone has won or the planet explodes!

The objective of Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet! is to be the first player to get their Aliens off the planet using resource cards, action cards, and phases of the moon to escape. If the planet explodes before everyone escapes, the player with the most saved Aliens wins.

What’s special about Lift Off! Get me off this Planet is that lift off points (space vehicles) are all different and often require multiple players to work together to take off. For example, a rocket ship takes a lot of resources and can carry 6 aliens from various players. This creates a great dynamic where initially all players are working together to get, say, the first half of their aliens off the planet, but once it starts thinning people become more competitive and tricky about things using action cards to manipulate the moon, change the board, create tornadoes, etc.

item.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 61
 - moving by turns -
Move forward according die roll; ending on a red marked space follow instructions glued into the lid. likely published 1938/39

Three hundred years ago, the wandering tribe of Scragen settled at the shores of the Pentibar Sea. Over the decades, the settlement grew to be a great city and from it was born the thriving Empire of Vistos.

Today, Vistos faces a unique challenge. Astemaed, 12th Emperor of the greatest empire the world has ever seen, has died without an heir. By law, it falls on the senate to elect his successor. Very few candidates are worthy in the eyes of the senate. You are among them. Through strength, cunning and the power of your wealth, you must persuade the senate to your side and thwart your rivals' attempts to do the same.

No higher seat of power exists, no greater title than Emperor of Vistos. Who's coin shall ring the loudest? Who's might shall overcome? Who's knowledge shall prove greatest? The world watches and waits as you attempt... To Be Emperor.

To Be Emperor is a strategy card game of bidding and resource management. By winning bids on Assets, you gain the resources necessary to maintain Senators you have won to your side as well as to affect game play. By winning bids on Senators, you bring yourself closer to victory. The first player to have persuaded Senators to their side worth 10 or more Influence in the senate is the next Emperor of Vistos. Take care, though. Bid too greedily on senators or use up your resources with haste and you may find the Senators in your pocket seeking deeper pockets elsewhere.

In the files section are PDF and zip files with the rules and all the cards ready for print and play. You will only need to provide tokens (five per player, a different color for each player). All I ask is that you contact me with any constructive criticism and ideas, how many games you played, how many players and how long for each game.

The Dice Manipulation and Strategy Game about Cyber Threats in the 21st Century.

ZERO Hour: Cyberspace is a game about creating and managing Cyber Threats in the 21st Century.

This is accomplished by using the innovative ZERO HOUR GAME SYSTEM. 
The ZERO HOUR GAME SYSTEM uses twenty-four sided (D24) dice that you as the player will manipulate and move as playing pieces through the course of the game.

This is the first in a series of unique games that will utilize the 
ZERO HOUR GAME SYSTEM in order to create a myriad of game experiences with one basic rules structure that you as players can expand to your liking.

The objective of each Player is to maneuver their Code Dice thru The Network (game board), and place two of their five Code Dice into any opposing active Player(s) Source space on the game board.

The game ends once one player achieves the objective of having two Code Dice in any opposing active Player(s) Source space. That player is immediately declared the Winner.

Alternatively, if all Players have a Terminated Hard Line, the game ends immediately. The Winner of the game is the player with the highest value showing on a Code Die in an opposing Player’s Source space.

The Winner of the Game is the player with the highest value showing on a Code Die in an opposing Player’s Source space.

item.description:
Wayward is a "choose your own adventure" style of game where you race to collect the most gold before the guards sound the alarm and try to trap you in the dungeon forever!

There are many ways to collect gold, such as battling in the fighting pit, stealing from the king's treasure room, digging up graves, or slugging your way through the bar brawl. Avoid the river squid or he may take your items! The risks you take can pay off with great rewards - or losses.

Items you pick up help you push past guards, pass through hazards, open locked doors, and increase your luck at collecting treasure. See if you can discover the best path to winning the game and escaping the dungeon!

Sanasokkelo (which means word labyrinth) is Finnish word game. Game consist of circular board, which has four rings of letter spaces and one letter space in the middle. Nearby letter spaces are connected with lines. There is 73 of these rounded holes in the board. At the start of every game you will randomize cardboard letter tiles to these holes. Now you decide how long you will play and turn around the board. Then everybody tries to make words with letters, that are connected with lines. When you find a word (at least four letters long), you shout it and collect the points. You get one point for every letter in the word you found. You get special points, if you can use the letter in the middle or letters in the third (red) circle. When time runs out, the player with most points is the winner. The game can be played in any language, which have approximately same letter distribution in words as in Finnish.

item.description:
Beasts of Burden is a quick-playing card game of treachery and debauchery for 2-6 people.

The central theme and mechanic of the game is managing encumbrance:

You and your backstabbing pals can only carry so much stuff yet, you will need certain treasures, tools, and weapons to survive monsters, traps, and puzzles. For example, Party Orcs can be defeated with either weapons or a barrel of brandy, while the Monster That Can Only Be Defeated By Flaming Arrows can only be defeated by... uh... flaming arrows.

Each player has a hand of 7 cards, drawn from the deck. There are three categories of cards, Items, Encounters and Effects.

You can only have 10 weight worth of weapon, tool, treasure and container cards in front of you, but you'll need a variety of item cards to defeat monster, quest and puzzle cards that are played in a 3x3 grid in the center of the table. Encounter cards are worth points, and the person with the most points after one of the four quests has been completed wins.

Throw in some fiendish traps and game-altering effects, and you have a table full of mayhem as players juggle weapons, treasure and sacks full of kittens as they navigate an increasingly absurd dungeon.

Darkness looms on the horizon. Strange signs have started to appear all over the world: seas flecked with blood, flocks of shadowy figures wheeling in the sky, prophetic visions that leave people mumbling in addled madness. The time has finally come. The Old Ones are stirring, and it’s your job to wake them up!

In Rise of Cthulhu you play as the leader of a cultist faction wishing to awaken Cthulhu and the other Old Ones awaken to rule this world. But a competing faction races against you to be the first to awaken these chaotic masters. By playing various numbered and colored Cultist Cards, you must control the prime Lovecraftian locations – Arkham, Dunwich, Innsmouth and Kingsport – in an effort to awaken an Old One. The faction that maintains the most influence on a location will gain favor when the Old One arises, while the losing faction risks the destruction of their sanity and souls. Through clever pairing of colored and numbered cards, players can summon dangerous Monster Cards to their aid, unlock the eldritch secrets of lost Artifact Cards, and even manipulate an Unspeakable Guardian to terrorize your opponent. All of this and more await the cunning and adventurous in this tactical card game of influence and horror for 2 players.

On your turn you will have 2 actions: you can either draw 2 cards, play 2 cards from your hand, or draw a card and play a card. Cards can be drawn from a face down deck of Cultist cards or a face up pile of discarded Cultists cards, known as the Valley. Cards must be played on your side of one of the four main Lovecraftian locations - Arkham, Dunwich, Innsmouth and Kingsport. The player with the most total points on a given location turns the location to face them, marking that location as being influenced by their cultists. As the values change during gameplay, locations will shift their influence from player to player. Playing three of the same color, three of the same number, or a run of three cards of the same color (ex. 2-3-4 of green) will earn players the right to draw from special Monster and Artifact cards to help their hold on locations or hinder their opponent. At key points in the game, Old Ones will be drawn from the Cultist Deck and attach themselves to a location: the player currently influencing that location will reap the benefits of the Old One. When all three Old Ones awaken, the game ends and the person with the most locations facing them (or points in play if there's a tie) is the winner.

item.description:
Based on the popular game concept of Werewolf and Mafia, Rumplestiltskin offers a re-imagined take with our Fairytale Games theme. Set as a party game best played with 6+ players, we've expanded upon the core mechanics and offer character traits, abilities, and spells you may use as either Rumplestiltskin, his clones or the villagers of Nottingham. You will play as well-known characters such as the Little Mermaid, Red Riding Hood, Briar Rose, Mad Hatter and more!

We, on the other hand have our twisted version called “Rumplestiltskin”. In this storyline, Rumplestilskin and his fellow imp have shapeshifted themselves into fairytale land. At night, they go out and murder random characters in order to use their life essence to make him even more powerful. The fairytale characters have gotten word about this and are working together to snuff him out and have him (and his imps) burn alive at the stake. But who can we really trust?

This is a group party game that’s about survival and wits. The Magic Mirror (the moderator) divides players into two secret teams – Team Rumplestiltskin (The two imps) and the Fairytale Characters. Team Rumplestilskin’s goal is to kill all of the victims before being discovered. The Fairytale Characters’ goal is to identify who is on Team Rumplestiltskin and vote to burn them alive.

Features:

42 Beautifully illustrated cards set in the Fairytale Games Universe)
New card mechanics - Traits
New card mechanics - Spells
New character abilities
Refreshing take on a classic game (werewolf/mafia)
NUMBER OF PLAYERS: 6-20 Players
GAME TIME: 30-90 Minutes

item.description:
"A Game of Travel... Adventures... Facts... Fun!"

Alaska! is an adventure game for the entire family. As you travel around the 49th state, you'll be collecting adventures and learning interesting facts about Alaskan history, geography and current events.

You travel around the state of Alaska to different destinations, collecting "adventures" as you go. Once you assemble a certain number of adventure sets, you return to Ketchikan. the first to do so wins.

SpeeDeck includes a set of cards, chips, cubes, and a stick. With these simple components you can play 5 different and unique games:

1. Chicken Run (2 players - 15min)
Each player is the driver of a car hurtling toward their opponent. Two cards are played from the players' hands each turn to determine the car mileage and position in a wall of fog. Without hitting, who can get the closest? Who will blink first?!?

2. Best Pitching (3-4 players - 30min)
In this speedy trick-taking game, players take on the role of a baseball pitcher attempting to win a game! The number of tricks which can be taken in a single round is determined in advance. Players compete for the specified number of rounds to get the most points.

3. Tumbling Dust (3 players - 15min)
Attempt to read the hands of the other players or you'll be at the mercy of the strong winds! Players can change the wind strength, direction, and movement of other players with the goal of collecting the most wind blown garbage.

4. Document Sort (2 players - 5min)
This is a real-time card sorting race between two players. Players compete to make a set arranged in numerical order before their opponent. Quick judgment and hand speed will be needed to win!

5. Parachute Dive (1 player - 10min)
Sky diving solitaire! Is it possible to land safely by controlling your rate of fall!? This game is played in two rounds. In round one, the player attempts to successfully deploy their parachute. In round two, the player has to land with their feet on the ground! Good luck!
